main event: A brilliant ball of fire was seen in the southern sky, visible for 500 miles, burning out after a few seconds and leaving a glowing vapor trail.
interesting points: The object was described by witnesses as a tremendous globe emitting a brilliant orange-red light., Witnesses reported a hissing sound accompanying the object., The sighting was reported from multiple locations including Tuscumbia, Alabama, and Houston, Texas., The object appeared more brilliant than any meteor seen before., A weather forecaster noted that it left a long, white smoke trail unheard of for meteors.
witness description: witnesses included Colonel H.M. Decker and a United States Weather forecaster.
